perfcenter.analytical

Class SolverMulti

  • java.lang.Object
    • perfcenter.analytical.SolverMulti
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SolverMultiClosedMVA

    public abstract class SolverMulti
extends java.lang.Object
    SolverMulti is an abstract class, which contains the methods initialize and solve multiclass models.
    Author:
    Federico Granata, Stefano Omini

        public SolverMulti(int classes,
           int stations)
        Creates a multiclasss solver
        Parameters:

        stations - number of stations.

    • Method Detail

      • input

        public boolean input(java.lang.String[] n,
            int[] t,
            double[][][] s,
            double[][] v,
            int[] sn)
        Initializes the Multiclass solver with the model parameters.
        Parameters:
        n - array of names of service centers.
        t - array of the types (LD or LI) of service centers.
        s - matrix of service time of the service centers.
        v - matrix of visits to the service centers.
        Returns:
        true if the operation is completed with success

      • solve

        public abstract void solve()
        Must be implemented to create a multi class model solver.

      • hasSufficientProcessingCapacity

        public abstract boolean hasSufficientProcessingCapacity()
        A system is said to have sufficient capacity to process a given load lambda if no service center is saturated as a result of the combined loads of all the classes.
        Must be implemented to create a multi class model solver.
        WARNING: This method should be called before solving the system.
        Returns:
        true if sufficient capacity exists for the given workload, false otherwise

      • getThroughput

        public double getThroughput(int cent,
                   int cls)
        Returns the throughput of the given class for the requested station
        Parameters:
        cent - the number of the service center
        cls - the customer class
        Returns:
        the throughput
